results.content:
This course is very, very, very basic, which is good when you have absolutely no idea what to do first. I have a rudimentary knowledge of HTML, and I thought that it was a nice refresher, but way too basic for me. If you have tweaked websites before, added an

tag or an tag anywhere, added a URL link in HTML code and actually had it work, I would suggest a more comprehensive course to get a more in-depth instruction on HTML. But, if you have no idea what I just wrote above and how they apply to HTML, this is an excellent course to start with. Andrew is very engaging and has a patient demeanor, and the Labs do give the beginner the elated satisfaction of "Hey! I just made a website!" You will definitely walk away with a few HTML codes under your belt and an understanding of how HTML code works, but I must stress again that this is definitely a course for "Beginning Beginners." Well done, Andrew!

response.content: Thank you for Patricia for enrolling and thank you very much for the review.
response.content_html: Thank you for Patricia for enrolling and thank you very much for the review.

results.content: I have been struggling in a college class to understand HTML, and this course broke topics down in more manageable pieces. Each section tested your knowledge and built on the previous lesson allowing you to apply your knowledge while getting more creative each time.
